title: Church Minshull Walks

images.title: Approaching Minshullhill Bridge near Church Minshull, Cheshire by Roger  Kidd, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Approaching Minshullhill Bridge near Church Minshull, Cheshire. The ten mile long Middlewich Branch is well worth navigating, (or walking). It runs mostly at a high level giving very good views over the surrounding countryside, as here where it crosses the River Weaver by an aqueduct. The Weaver itself is navigable, but not up here.

images.title: Mike Harris / River Weaver
images.caption: View up the River Weaver from Church Minshull Bridge on Cross Lane. Parish boundary of Church Minshull and Minshull Vernon.

images.title: Peter Styles / River Weaver from Shropshire Union Canal
images.caption: River Weaver from towpath of the Shropshire Union Canal as it flows through the aqueduct

images.title: Ronhjones, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Church Minshull

images.title: St. Bartholomew's, Church Minshull by Phil Platt, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: St. Bartholomew's, Church Minshull

description: This pretty Cheshire village is located next to the Shropshire Union Canal near Crewe. This walk from the village takes you along the Middlewich Branch of the Shropshire Union Canal to Barbridge. On the way there are nice views of the River Weaver and the surrounding countryside. Part of the walk uses a section of the Crewe and Nantwich Circular Walk . You can use this popular waymarked trail to further explore the highlights of the area. Scroll down for the full list of walks around Church Minshull.
